revised_title: Cathodic Water-Gas Equilibrium in Gaseous Combustion
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on gaseous combustion in electric discharges to study the cathodic water-gas equilibrium. They found that the rate of combustion and the position of equilibrium varied with the final gas pressure. The results suggest that the cathodic combustion of carbonic oxide in moist mixtures occurs through two distinct ways, with pressure favoring one and disfavoring the other.
